etymology.description: Phonetic 尚(尚) (shàng, 'still') + Semantic 衣(衣) (yī, 'clothing') = lower garment, skirt
etymology.interpretation: The character emphasizes clothing related to the lower body, with 尚(尚) (shàng, 'still') providing the sound component while 衣(衣) (yī, 'clothing') indicates the meaning.

examples.chinese: 她穿上轻薄的裳(她穿上輕薄的裳)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chuān shàng qīng bó de cháng.
examples.english: She put on a light lower garment.

examples.chinese: 宫廷女子佩戴华丽的裳(宮廷女子佩戴華麗的裳)，在花园中漫步(在花園中漫步)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngtíng nǚzǐ pèidài huálì de cháng, zài huāyuán zhōng mànbù.
examples.english: The palace lady wore a gorgeous lower garment as she strolled in the garden.

examples.chinese: 她喜欢用细绸制成的裳(她喜歡用細綢制成的裳)，作为夏日衣服(作為夏日衣服)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xǐhuān yòng xì chóu zhìchéng de cháng, zuòwéi xiàrì yīfú.
examples.english: She likes lower garments made of fine silk as summer clothes.
